metadata.description: A pipeline that reads from a GCS bucket and writes to Splunk's HTTP Event Collector (HEC).
metadata.name: GCS to Splunk

parameters.helpText: GCS files to read the input. Example: gs://mybucket/test-*.csv
parameters.label: GCS file pattern to search for CSV files
parameters.name: inputFileSpec

parameters.helpText: True if CSVs include headers or False if they do not.
parameters.label: GCS file pattern to search for CSV files
parameters.name: containsHeaders

parameters.helpText: The delimiter that the CSV uses. Example: ,
parameters.label: CSV delimiter
parameters.name: delimiter

parameters.helpText:
Csv format according to [Apache Commons CSV format](https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/apidocs/org/apache/commons/csv/CSVFormat.html). Default is: Default.
NOTE: Must match format names exactly found [here](http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-csv/apidocs/org/apache/commons/csv/CSVFormat.Predefined.html#Default)
parameters.label: CSV delimiter
parameters.name: csvFormat

parameters.helpText: Path to JSON schema, ex gs://path/to/schema. Default: null.
parameters.label: Path to JSON schema
parameters.name: jsonSchemaPath

parameters.helpText: The full URL of your .js file. Example: gs://your-bucket/your-function.js
parameters.label: GCS location of your JavaScript UDF
parameters.name: javascriptTextTransformGcsPath

parameters.helpText: The function name should only contain letters, digits and underscores. Example: 'transform' or 'transform_udf1'.
parameters.label: The name of the JavaScript function you wish to call as your UDF
parameters.name: javascriptTextTransformFunctionName

parameters.helpText: Google Cloud Storage path where to write objects that could not be converted to Splunk objects or pushed to Splunk. Ex: gs://your-bucket/your-path
parameters.label: Invalid events output path
parameters.name: invalidOutputPath

parameters.helpText: Splunk Http Event Collector (HEC) authentication token.
parameters.label: HEC Authentication token.
parameters.name: token

parameters.helpText: Splunk Http Event Collector (HEC) url. This should be routable from the VPC in which the pipeline runs. e.g. https://splunk-hec-host:8088
parameters.label: Splunk HEC URL.
parameters.name: url

parameters.helpText: Batch size for sending multiple events to Splunk HEC. Default: 1 (no batching).
parameters.label: Batch size for sending multiple events to Splunk HEC.
parameters.name: batchCount

parameters.helpText: Maximum number of parallel requests. Default: 1 (no parallelism).
parameters.label: Maximum number of parallel requests.
parameters.name: parallelism

parameters.helpText: Disable SSL certificate validation (true/false). Default: false (validation enabled). If true, the certificates are not validated (all certificates are trusted) and  `rootCaCertificatePath` parameter is ignored.
parameters.label: Disable SSL certificate validation.
parameters.name: disableCertificateValidation
